result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristin Leigh Baum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kristin Leigh Baum is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kristin Leigh Baum was found guilty of Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Baum, Kristin Leigh

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: from Judge Rohl to DOC letter "please do an amended JOC reflecting 405 days credit"
from DOC Staff re: believes the Defendant to be entitled to 405 days credit instead of the 145 days.
Partial. Sentencing after Revocation held on March 20, 2018
from Atty Nelson re: representation has ended.

10:02Defendant Kristin Leigh Baum in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant Kristin Leigh Baum in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich and Nelson both have received the revocation summary. Atty Froelich adds to revocation; treatment or absconding. DOC is recommending 4 years total; 2 years initial confinement and 2 years ES.  Froelich addresses sentencing. PO Sheila Drazkowski addresses the court. Atty Nelson addresses sentencing; time less than a year to run concurrent with other case. 145 days credit. Atty Froelich addresses benefits of a prison sentencing. Atty Nelson addresses disadvantages of prison sentencing. Defendant addresses. Court goes over sentencing factors.  Court orders: 4 years in the prison system. 2 years initial confinement and 2 years ES; concurrent with prison sentencing currently serving. 145 days credit. conditions of ES: payment of restitution and court costs, compliance with all the rules set by Agent,   Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 10:27

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 20, 2018 at 09:45 am.
from Probation/Parole Agent Sheila Drazkowski re: asking for 2 years initial confinement and 2 years followed by ES.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 10:48 a.m.  Defendant Kristin Leigh Baum in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant Kristin Leigh Baum in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Froelich - Ct 1 - recommends S/W 3 years, concurrent.  Been in custody since January 26, 2015.  Restitution in the amount of $455 joint and several and no contact with victim Patrick Smith.  Ct 2 - State moves to dismiss.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant.    Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to count 1.  Facts are correct.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.    The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of count 1. Court dismisses count 2.  Court orders S/W 3 years probation, concurrent with extended supervision; court costs $515.  No contact with Patrick Smith. Restitution in the amount of $455 joint and several with co-defendants in this case.  Appear rights given to defendant.

ADDRESS INFO for Kristin Leigh Baum
Current: 615 STOKKE PARKWAY, DUNN COUNTY JAIL, Menomonie, WI 54751 United States  (Effective: 02-23-2015)
Prior: N502 - 300th Street, Maiden Rock, WI 54750

District Attorney Sean Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kristin Leigh Baum in Court from custody with Attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Case called at 2:18 p.m.  S/T Investigator Douglas Ducklow.  Direct by DA Froelich.  Defendant identified.  Cross.  Redirect.  Court makes findings; sufficient evidence that Defendant probably committed a felony and binds Defendant over for trial.  DA Froelich presents Court with Information.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and enters NG pleas on both counts.  Atty. Nelson notes that Defendant is on PO hold.  Court reiterates bond conditions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

BOND CONDITIONS READ TO THE DEFENDANT BY THE COURT COMMISSIONER
ADDRESS:  SAME AS COMPLAINT 
DOB:  05-21-1987
PHONE:  715-448-4410 AND CELL: 715-307-1382

Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant has copy of complaint  Charges read to the defendant   Defendant waives reading of the complaint  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.
